7 //-----------------------------PLATFORM DIRECTIVES------------------------------
8 
9 // These directives are used for determining what platform this code is being
10 // compiled for. While it may look at little strange that they are initially
11 // defined and then undefined again if they are not valid: this is done solely
12 // so correct Doxygen docs can be built for the preprocessor no matter what
13 // platform Doxygen is running from.
14 
19 #define CHAOS_OS_WINDOWS
20 // clean up so code can still run as expected
21 #ifndef _WIN32
22  #undef CHAOS_OS_WINDOWS
23 #endif
24 
29 #define CHAOS_OS_UNIX
30 // clean up so code can still run as expected
31 #if !defined( __APPLE__ ) && !defined( __linux ) && !defined( __unix )
32  #undef CHAOS_OS_UNIX
33 #endif
34

62 #define CHAOS_OS_UNKNOWN
63 // clean up so code can still run as expected
64 #if defined( CHAOS_OS_WINDOWS ) || defined( CHAOS_OS_UNIX )
65  #undef CHAOS_OS_UNKNOWN
66 #endif

80 #define CHAOS_DISALLOW_CONSTRUCTION( TypeName ) \
81  TypeName() = delete; \
82  TypeName( const TypeName& ) = delete; \
83  void operator=( const TypeName& ) = delete
